text: @davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency So, what a nasty cocktail of pollution in the air to breathe in: noxious gas, landfill dust, leachate, surface odour and chemical odour-masking spray! And public health and environment agencies do nothing?! Disgraceful neglect of people's health! @BorisJohnson  @MattHancock

@DeniseO97662017 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency It's like a dystopian movie plot , with Adam obviously as the baddy .

text: @Hutch_and_Sons @sascampaigns @AnneMarieMorris @10DowningStreet @SouthWestWater @EnvAgencySW @TDC_Leisure @SustainableBis1 Water quality has been poor for a while now. There‚Äôs been lots of intense rainfall onto hard ground so run off is possible. However, we are also in ‚ÄúMay bloom‚Äù season especially with the sunny weather in April. This is (relatively) harmless algae and not unusual. Ruins fishing!
@davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @DefraGovUK @Ofwat @EnvAgency I know, that's what I mean Dave - dangerous stuff üëé

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: @joe_crowley @RosieP4 @BBCCountryfile @EnvAgency It's not just human excrement, condoms and wipes, by the way. It's farm runoffs that include pesticides, nitrogen fertilisers. Stuff that's difficult to trace back to source. Rivers are something we should proudly protect, but we're descending into making them sewers instead.

RT @mbarnett87: I noticed the smell had hit #Kidsgrove, #StokeonTrent, #Staffordshire about 2 weeks ago because of the wind direction.

@St‚Ä¶

RT @Markmalkin15: @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink This morning‚Ä¶

The pic  above  shows the River Lea where it's joined by the Flood Relief Channel. I would press for the green open spaces to be retained and for @wfcouncil to work more closely with the @EnvAgencySE & @thameswater to prevent flooding and improve drainage.
RT @EllieChowns: More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile‚Ä¶

text:
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf

It's absolutely vital  ban is legally watertight & that all breaches are rapidly prosecuted.  It requires properly functioning legal team in @EnvAgency.  We don't have that now (e.g. turning blind eye to flagrant water pollution offences). https://t.co/jvIkSGi8dR

@Feargal_Sharkey @ManOfKent15 @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency It's not just the shit - everything poured down the domestic system - bleach, washing liquid, cleaners etc - things we can't see. The point is if we can see the wetwipe then all these other elements are also present. Consider wipes an indicator rather than the sole problem.
